abstracts.cdata!:
Over the long term, objective of the
            Private Sector Competitiveness and Economic Diversification
            Project in Lesotho is to add more value to horticultural
            products grown in Lesotho, particularly vegetables, and
            fruit crops such as apples and cherries. Lesotho has faced
            land degradation and environmental crises of massive
            proportions for some time. Extreme care has to be taken to
            avoid the negative impacts that may accompany the
            implementation of the Project. The potential use of
            agrochemicals, in particular pesticides, under the
            prevailing poor management and weak regulatory environment,
            is fraught with serious environmental including human health
            dangers. Likewise, use of fertilizers, in particular
            nitrogenous, under poor field management, entails
            potentially serious issues of soil and water contamination,
            primarily through leaching and runoff. Careful attention
            must be paid to nitrogenous forms. Use of agricultural best
            management practices should be encouraged through their use,
            field demonstration, and farmers training to mitigate
            negative aspects of the project.
